skill.name: structlog
skill.description: Structured logging for Python applications with context support and powerful processors
skill.summary: Structured logging for Python applications with context support and powerful processors
skill.author: bossjones

security_audit.summary: The static analyzer incorrectly flagged Python code examples as shell command execution. All detected patterns are safe code snippets in markdown documentation, not actual security vulnerabilities.

content.value_statement: Traditional Python logging produces hard-to-parse text output. Structlog provides structured logging with JSON output and context binding for better observability.
actual_capabilities: Configure structured logging with JSON output
Integrate with Python's standard logging module
Test logging behavior with built-in utilities
limitations: Learning curve for traditional logging users

use_cases.title: API request logging
use_cases.description: Log HTTP requests with persistent context like request_id and user_id for tracing

use_cases.title: Application monitoring
use_cases.description: Generate structured logs for log aggregation systems like ELK or Splunk

use_cases.title: Debugging applications
use_cases.description: Use context binding to track data flow through complex applications

prompt_templates.title: Basic setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to configure structlog to output JSON logs with timestamps and log levels

prompt_templates.title: Context binding
prompt_templates.prompt: Demonstrate how to bind request_id and user_id to a logger so they appear in all log entries

prompt_templates.title: Custom processors
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a structlog processor that adds the current function name to every log entry

prompt_templates.title: Testing logs
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to capture and assert log entries in pytest using structlog's testing utilities

output_examples.input: Configure structlog for production JSON logging
output: Context data preserved across log calls

best_practices: Use context binding for request-scoped data
anti_patterns: Creating new loggers in every function
Mixing print statements with structured logs

faq.question: Is structlog compatible with Python's logging module?
faq.answer: Yes, structlog integrates seamlessly with the standard library logging module.

faq.question: Can I use structlog in existing projects?
faq.answer: Yes, you can gradually adopt structlog alongside existing logging code.

faq.question: Does structlog support async Python?
faq.answer: Yes, structlog works with both sync and async Python applications.

faq.question: How do I migrate from standard logging?
faq.answer: Start by configuring structlog to use LoggerFactory, then replace log calls gradually.

faq.question: Can I customize the log format?
faq.answer: Yes, you can create custom processors to modify log output format.

faq.question: Is structlog suitable for high-performance applications?
faq.answer: Yes, with proper configuration including logger caching and efficient processors.
